title: How to View Posts from Blocked Twitter Accounts: Easy Guide

steps.title: Go to a user's profile.
steps.content: Go to a user's profile. In the past, when X was Twitter, you had to log out of your account to view an account that blocked you. However, you can now view tweets from any public account, even if they have you blocked. [1] X Research source You can use this method to view the account of someone who blocked you on both the X website and using the X mobile app.

steps.title: View the tweets.
steps.content: View the tweets. You can find the user's posts below their bio. If the user has a public account, you should be able to see all their posts and reposts, even if you're blocked. If the user has a private account, you won't be able to see any posts or reposts. Keep in mind that being blocked will still keep you from interacting with the user and their posts. You can view posts, but you won't be able to reply, repost, or message them directly.

steps.title: Go to the blocked account.
steps.content: Go to the blocked account. Open X in a web browser and go to the user who has blocked you on X. Note: As of November 2024, you no longer need to log out of X to view posts of a public account that has blocked you. However, if you want to interact with the tweets, you'll need to use an alternate account to like, comment, or repost them.

steps.title: Copy the profile address.
steps.content: Copy the profile address. Move to the URL box and copy their X page's URL in the address bar.

steps.title: Log out of X.
steps.content: Log out of X. Select your profile picture, then select Log out . Alternatively, open a private or incognito tab on your browser to skip the log-out step.

steps.title: Log in to another account.
steps.content: Log in to another account. Since you can't view tweets without an account, you'll need to log into an alternate account.

steps.title: Paste their X URL into your browser's address bar and hit the Enter button.
steps.content: Paste their X URL into your browser's address bar and hit the Enter button. This will load up the X profile of the user who has blocked you. You can now see and interact with the tweets from your alternate account.

steps.title: Yes, you can view tweets from a Twitter user who blocked you.
steps.content: Yes, you can view tweets from a Twitter user who blocked you. In the past, you were unable to view someone's tweets if you were signed into an account that has been blocked. However, as of November 2024, anyone can see public posts regardless of block status. If you're blocked, you still can't interact with the user (such as comment, repost, or Direct Message), but you can still see the user's posts. To view tweets from someone you blocked you, simply search for them and navigate to their profile. If you're blocked by a private account , you won't be able to see their tweets unless the account is set back to "Public".

steps.title: If you're blocked, you'll see a message that says so on their profile.
steps.content: If you're blocked, you'll see a message that says so on their profile. Even though you can still view the tweets of someone who blocked you on Twitter, you'll still see a message on their profile telling you that you're blocked. You also won't be able to like, reply to, or repost one of their tweets or tag them in photos. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Can you search for someone on Twitter if they blocked you?
steps.content: Can you search for someone on Twitter if they blocked you? Yes, you can still search for users on Twitter/X even if they have you blocked. You can still find and see their posts. However, you won't be able to comment, repost, or otherwise interact with their content. You also cannot send them Direct Messages.

steps.title: How do you know if someone blocked you on Twitter?
steps.content: How do you know if someone blocked you on Twitter? Just go to the person's profile and you'll see a message that says you're blocked. You can also try to like or reply to one of their posts. If you're unable to do so, they've blocked you. You also won't be able to follow or tag the user in a post if they've blocked you. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Can I stop people from seeing my tweets?
steps.content: Can I stop people from seeing my tweets? In the past, blocking someone on X would hide your tweets from them. However, blocked users can now see your tweets regardless of their block status. To completely hide your tweets from someone you blocked, you must set your account to Private .

steps.title: Did they block me or deactivate Twitter?
steps.content: Did they block me or deactivate Twitter? Since you can now see all public posts regardless of block status, you can easily check if someone deactivated Twitter by visiting their profile. If their profile doesn't appear, they most likely deactivated or deleted their account . However, the user could have also changed their username .

steps.title: How do you know if someone soft blocked you on Twitter?
steps.content: How do you know if someone soft blocked you on Twitter? Soft block refers to someone blocking you temporarily and then removing the block. This action is usually done to force you to unfollow a user quietly without any notifications. To check if someone soft blocked you, check if you're still following them. If you're no longer following them but can still interact with their posts, it's possible the user soft blocked you. On the other hand, it could be unintentionally caused by a software bug.
